snippet: An all-day voting session by self-governing philharmonic musicians failed to produce a candidate to succeed Simon Rattle.
abstract: Members of Berlin Philharmonic fail to elect successor to chief conductor and artistic director Simon Rattle, who will step down in 2018; self-governing orchestra is unusual and candidates must win votes of clear majority of musicians before taking post as conductor.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER and KATARINA JOHANNSEN

lead_paragraph: An all-day voting session by self-governing philharmonic musicians failed to produce a candidate to succeed Simon Rattle.

headline.main: No New Conductor Chosen for Berlin Philharmonic
